# GitHub Copilot Instructions for CCR Website

## Project Overview
This is the official website for **Cleanique Coders Resources (CCR)**, an IT consulting and software development company founded in 2016. The project is built with **Next.js 16**, **React 19**, **TypeScript**, and **Tailwind CSS**, featuring a modern component-based architecture with shadcn/ui.

## Technology Stack & Conventions

### Core Technologies

- **Framework**: Next.js 16.0.0 with App Router
- **React**: 19.2.0 with TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4.1.9 with CSS variables
- **UI Components**: shadcn/ui (New York style) with Radix UI primitives
- **Package Manager**: pnpm 10.12.1
- **Icons**: Lucide React
- **Analytics**: Vercel Analytics
- **Theming**: next-themes with dark/light mode support

### Project Structure & Path Aliases

```
@/components ‚Üí /components
@/lib ‚Üí /lib
@/hooks ‚Üí /hooks
@/ui ‚Üí /components/ui
```

### Code Style & Patterns

#### TypeScript Conventions

- Use `import type` for type-only imports
- Prefer `React.ReactNode` for children props
- Use proper TypeScript interfaces and types
- Follow strict TypeScript configuration

#### Component Patterns

- **Client Components**: Use `"use client"` directive when needed (state, effects, browser APIs)
- **Server Components**: Default for static content and layouts
- **Component Structure**: Export default functions with descriptive names
- **Props**: Use TypeScript interfaces for component props
- **Styling**: Use Tailwind classes with the `cn()` utility for conditional styling

#### Naming Conventions

- **Components**: PascalCase (e.g., `Hero.tsx`, `ThemeProvider.tsx`)
- **Files**: kebab-case for non-components (e.g., `use-mobile.ts`)
- **Directories**: lowercase (e.g., `components/ui/`)
- **CSS Classes**: Tailwind utility classes with responsive prefixes

### UI Component Guidelines

#### shadcn/ui Integration

- Use existing UI components from `/components/ui/` directory
- Follow the established button variants: `default`, `destructive`, `outline`, `secondary`, `ghost`, `link`
- Size variants: `default`, `sm`, `lg`, `icon`, `icon-sm`, `icon-lg`
- Always use the `cn()` utility for className merging

#### Styling Patterns

- **Color System**: Use CSS variables (--primary, --secondary, --accent, --background, --foreground)
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first with `sm:`, `md:`, `lg:`, `xl:` prefixes
- **Dark Mode**: Use `dark:` prefix for dark theme styles
- **Animations**: Use Tailwind animation classes with proper transitions

#### Card Design System - CRITICAL STYLING RULES

**‚ùå FORBIDDEN CARD BACKGROUNDS ‚ùå**
**NEVER EVER use these classes that create yellowish/warm tinted backgrounds:**
- `bg-card` - Creates yellowish background
- `bg-card/50` - Creates yellowish/warm tinted background
- `bg-card/30` (except for section backgrounds only)
- `hover:bg-card` - Creates yellowish hover state

**‚úÖ ALWAYS USE THESE CARD PATTERNS:**

**Standard Card Pattern (Main cards like Services, Projects, Open Source featured):**
```tsx
<div className="p-8 bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border rounded-3xl">
```

**Grid Cards Pattern (Projects grid, Open Source popular/recent):**
```tsx
<div className="p-6 bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border rounded-2xl">
```

**Section Backgrounds ONLY:**
```tsx
<section className="bg-card/30"> // Only for section backgrounds, NOT individual cards
```

**Icon Containers:**
```tsx
<div className="bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border/50 rounded-full">
```

**Card Styling Standards:**
- **Main Cards**: `bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border rounded-3xl`
- **Grid Cards**: `bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border rounded-2xl`
- **Section Backgrounds**: `bg-card/30` (sections only, never individual cards)
- **Icon Containers**: `bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border/50`

**Hover States:**
```tsx
hover:border-primary/30 hover:shadow-lg hover:scale-[1.02]
// For focused states:
border-primary/50 shadow-2xl scale-[1.02]
// For button hover backgrounds:
hover:bg-background/70 // NOT hover:bg-card
```

**Background Gradients for Hover:**
```tsx
<div className="absolute inset-0 bg-linear-to-br from-primary/5 to-primary/10 opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100 transition-opacity duration-500" />
```

**‚ùå WRONG Examples (NEVER USE THESE):**
- ‚ùå `bg-card/50` - Creates yellowish background
- ‚ùå `bg-card` - Wrong background color
- ‚ùå `hover:bg-card` - Creates yellowish hover state
- ‚ùå `bg-muted` - Inconsistent with design system

**‚úÖ CORRECT Examples (ALWAYS USE THESE):**
- ‚úÖ `bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border`
- ‚úÖ `hover:bg-background/70` for button hover states
- ‚úÖ `bg-card/30` (only for section backgrounds)
- ‚úÖ Follow the Services component pattern as the reference

#### Icon System - Lucide React

This project exclusively uses **Lucide React** for all icons. Lucide provides a comprehensive set of beautiful, customizable SVG icons.

##### Installation & Import
```tsx
import { IconName } from "lucide-react"
```

##### Commonly Used Icons in the Project
- **Navigation**: `Menu`, `X`, `ArrowRight`, `ExternalLink`
- **UI Elements**: `Play`, `Calendar`, `MessageCircle`, `Star`, `Sparkles`
- **Theme**: `Moon`, `Sun` (for dark/light mode toggle)
- **Services**: `Code2`, `Zap`, `Shield`, `BookOpen`, `GitBranch`, `FileText`
- **Training**: `Target`, `Lightbulb`, `Users`, `Award`, `Clock`
- **Technology**: `Globe`, `Smartphone`, `Cloud`, `BarChart3`
- **Stats**: `TrendingUp`, `Calendar`, `Award`
- **Social**: `Linkedin`, `Github`, `Twitter`, `Youtube`, `Mail`

##### Icon Usage Patterns

**Basic Icon Usage:**
```tsx
import { ArrowRight, Calendar } from "lucide-react"

// Standard icon with sizing
<ArrowRight className="w-5 h-5" />

// Icon with color
<Calendar className="w-6 h-6 text-primary" />
```

**Dynamic Icon Rendering:**
```tsx
const services = [
  {
    icon: Code2,
    title: "Development",
    // ...
  }
]

// Render dynamic icons
{services.map((service, index) => {
  const Icon = service.icon
  return (
    <div key={index}>
      <Icon className="w-8 h-8 text-primary" />
      <h3>{service.title}</h3>
    </div>
  )
})}
```

**Icon Sizing Standards:**
- Small icons: `w-4 h-4` (16px)
- Default icons: `w-5 h-5` (20px) or `w-6 h-6` (24px)
- Large icons: `w-8 h-8` (32px)
- Extra large icons: `w-10 h-10` (40px)

**Icon Color Standards:**
- Primary actions: `text-primary`
- Secondary actions: `text-muted-foreground`
- Success states: `text-green-600`
- Warning states: `text-yellow-600`
- Error states: `text-red-600`
- Social media: Use brand colors (e.g., `text-blue-600` for LinkedIn)

##### Icon Guidelines
1. **Never use emoji or other icon libraries** - stick to Lucide React exclusively
2. **Import only needed icons** to keep bundle size optimal
3. **Use semantic icon names** that match their purpose
4. **Apply consistent sizing** across similar UI elements
5. **Use proper color tokens** from the design system
6. **Ensure accessibility** with proper ARIA labels when needed

##### Icon Animation Examples
```tsx
// Hover animations
<ArrowRight className="w-5 h-5 group-hover:translate-x-1 transition-transform" />

// Loading states
<Loader2 className="w-4 h-4 animate-spin" />
```

#### Component Architecture

- **Layout Components**: Header, Footer, and page-level components
- **Section Components**: Hero, Services, Projects, Training, CTA
- **UI Primitives**: Reusable components in `/components/ui/`
- **Theme Provider**: Centralized theme management

### Development Guidelines

#### Code Quality

- Use TypeScript strict mode
- Implement proper error handling
- Follow React best practices (hooks, state management)
- Use semantic HTML elements
- Ensure accessibility compliance

#### Performance Optimization

- Use Next.js Image component for optimized images
- Implement lazy loading where appropriate
- Minimize client-side JavaScript for better performance
- Use proper caching strategies

#### SEO & Metadata

- Implement proper meta tags in layout.tsx
- Use descriptive page titles and descriptions
- Follow semantic HTML structure
- Ensure proper heading hierarchy (h1, h2, h3)

### Coding Instructions

When generating code for this project:

1. **Always use TypeScript** with proper type definitions
2. **Use the established component patterns** found in existing components
3. **Follow the shadcn/ui design system** and component API
4. **Use Tailwind CSS** with the project's color system and design tokens
5. **Implement responsive design** with mobile-first approach
6. **Support dark/light themes** using CSS variables
7. **Use proper semantic HTML** for accessibility
8. **Follow the existing file structure** and naming conventions
9. **Import components** using the established path aliases
10. **Use the `cn()` utility** for conditional className merging
11. **Use Lucide React icons exclusively** - never use emoji or other icon libraries
12. **Apply consistent icon sizing and colors** following the established patterns
13. **üö® CRITICAL: NEVER USE YELLOWISH CARD BACKGROUNDS üö®**
    - ‚ùå FORBIDDEN: `bg-card`, `bg-card/50`, `hover:bg-card` - These create yellowish backgrounds
    - ‚úÖ ALWAYS USE: `bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border` for cards
    - ‚úÖ For hover: `hover:bg-background/70` NOT `hover:bg-card`
14. **Reference the Services component** as the standard for card design patterns

#### Example Component Structure

```tsx
"use client" // Only when needed

import type React from "react"
import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

interface ComponentProps {
  className?: string
  children: React.ReactNode
}

export default function Component({ className, children }: ComponentProps) {
  return (
    <div className={cn("default-classes", className)}>
      {children}
    </div>
  )
}
```

### Package Management

- Use `pnpm` for all package operations
- Follow the existing dependency structure
- Prefer exact versions for UI libraries
- Use latest versions for development tools

This project represents a professional consulting company's web presence, so maintain high code quality, accessibility standards, and modern web development practices throughout all implementations.

### üö® CRITICAL CARD STYLING REMINDER üö®

**THE PROBLEM**: The CSS variable `--card` in this project creates a yellowish/warm background that breaks the clean, professional design aesthetic.

**THE SOLUTION**: Always use `bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border` for card backgrounds instead.

**EXAMPLES OF WHAT NOT TO DO:**
- ‚ùå `bg-card` - Creates yellowish background
- ‚ùå `bg-card/50` - Creates yellowish/warm tinted background
- ‚ùå `hover:bg-card` - Creates yellowish hover state

**EXAMPLES OF WHAT TO DO:**
- ‚úÖ `bg-background/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border` - Clean, professional background
- ‚úÖ `hover:bg-background/70` - Proper hover state
- ‚úÖ `bg-card/30` - Only for section backgrounds, never individual cards

**REFERENCE**: Follow the Services component pattern as the gold standard for card styling.
